snippet: Politicians in both London and Washington are looking into whether regulators allowed banks to report false interest rates in the run-up to the 2008 financial crisis and afterward.
abstract: Politicians in both London and Washington are looking into whether regulators allowed banks to report false interest rates in the run-up to the 2008 financial crisis and afterward.

byline.original: By BEN PROTESS and MARK SCOTT

headline.main: Bank Scandal Turns Spotlight to Regulators
headline.print_headline: Bank Scandal Turns Spotlight To Regulators
